name: buzzer.frequency()
content:
Makes the buzzer play at a specific frequency and duration.

[`buzzer.frequency()`(#f78183)](/docs/applab/buzzer.frequency/) determines what tone the buzzer will play, and for how long this tone will play for. This command is more customizable than `.note()` because you can choose the frequency you want up to around 500hz (About the 4th octave on the musical scale). Any frequency above 1000hz cannot play on the buzzer.

[`buzzer.frequency()`(#f78183)](/docs/applab/buzzer.frequency/) has a parameter for duration too. If the duration is not specified, then the tone will play continuously.

palette_params.name: frequency
palette_params.description: The number deciding the pitch and note of the sound being played.

palette_params.name: duration
palette_params.description: Length of how long the buzzer will play the frequency for in milliseconds.

short_description: Makes the buzzer play at a specific frequency and duration.
tips:
* Extremely low and high frequencies can come out sounding distorted. The most usable frequencies are in the range of 261-987.
* The higher the frequency, the higher the tone will sound.
